entry.title: Homeless Commission shelves plans for Winchester Street camp following public outcry
entry.summary: A proposal to locate a campground for the unhoused on Northeast Winchester Street in Roseburg was quickly scuttled by the city’s Homeless Commission on Monday following a public meeting in which speaker after speaker railed against the idea.

entry.title: WISH UPON A STAR 12.11.23
entry.summary: Another season of giving begins with Wish Upon A Star from Brooke Communications and Rogue Credit Union. Today, we are introduced to a young woman who just lost a parent, a rock and a mentor. Faced with a mountain of stuff to accomplish, loose ends to tie up, all while trying to grieve the loss.

entry.title: MEDFORD WOMAN DIES IN PEDESTRIAN VERSUS SEMI-TRUCK ACCIDENT FRIDAY NIGHT
entry.summary: December 11, 2023 2:30 p.m. A Medford woman died in a pedestrian versus semi-truck accident Friday night. An Oregon State Police report said shortly before 6:00 p.m. troopers responded to Interstate 5 southbound near milepost 75. That is near Wolf Creek a few miles south of the Douglas/Josephine County border. The preliminary investigation indicated the...

entry.title: INSIDE DOUGLAS COUNTY 12.11.23
entry.summary: Sutherlin High School Principal Sean Radford is Oregon’s Assistant Principal of the Year. He talks about his 15 years in education, what he likes about what he does, and the needs of high school students currently. Click here to download for later listening; IDC 12 11 23

entry.summary: Santa, Mrs. Claus, reindeer and nativity scenes rolled down the streets of South County on Saturday night as part of the annual D.R. Johnson Memorial Timber Trucker's Light Parade.

entry.title: WINTER WHALE WATCH WEEK RETURNS TO OREGON COAST
entry.summary: December 11, 2023 2:50 a.m. Winter Whale Watch Week returns to the to the Oregon coast from Wednesday December 27th through Sunday December 31st. entry.title: Myrtle Creek Man jailed for alleged assault incidents
entry.summary: MYRTLE CREEK — Deputies with the Douglas County Sheriff’s Office jailed a man Thursday for alleged assault incidents.

entry.title: City of Reedsport seeks to fill vacant city council position
entry.summary: REEDSPORT — The city of Reedsport is seeking to fill a vacant seat on the Reedsport City Council until Dec. 31, 2024. During the general election in Nov. 2024, that same position will be open for a new four-year term.

entry.title: Roseburg woman dies in vehicle vs. pedestrian accident
entry.summary: WINCHESTER — A Roseburg woman died after she was struck by a vehicle early Thursday.

entry.title: Motorcyclists and radio hosts collect presents during Rudolph Run
entry.summary: A parade of motorcyclists, radio trucks, tow trucks and a few large box trucks wandered around Roseburg on Saturday, hitting up about 25 different stores as they picked up Christmas presents.

entry.title: Paid Leave Oregon leaves applicants panicked
entry.summary: Todd Scrivner is having surgery to remove his brain tumor Tuesday and after a month of waiting, he has yet to be approved for Paid Leave Oregon.
